body.name: The Silence Before Dawn: An absolutely heartbreaking and breathtaking World War II historical novel (WW2 Resistance Series)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gripping Story that Grabs You from the First Page and Doesn't Let Go
reviews.reviewText: So many times, history forgets the incredibly brave and resourceful women who fought in WW2 against the Nazis.Reading the sample text Amazon provides, it was obvious most of the book was written in 1st person. Normally I don't go for that, but as Amanda Lees has the well-deserved reputation of being an excellent author, I was willing to give it a shot and....OMG, from the first page, I was riveted to the storyline. Other reviewers here have shared the details, so I'll simply say that being transported into the world of WW2 via the vivid descriptions... and visualizing in my mind the courageous women who made a huge difference in the war was quite frankly, a gift. It was like I could literally *see* the action taking place... and the women (gutsy, undaunted no matter what happened) ignored their own safety to rescue their loved ones and fight for their own country.Highly recommended... so glad this is part of a series so more will be coming down the road!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love can be for many things and for many reasons.
reviews.reviewText: This story is one I could identify with because I love my freedom and my country. I would fight for freedom but not just for myself. I would fight for my husband, my children, my girlfriends, the family I love, the honorable people who are just trying to make a living. I am inspired by the underdog winning against tyranny and tyrants. Radicalism is dangerous because it replaces common sense and decency. We have witnessed it even in some of our own friends or family who lose the ability to reason for themselves. WWII was a lesson we must remember.Amanda Lees has captured the essence of how some will dedicate their very lives to preserve freedom. Some will be weakened by the presumption that they are superior to their fellow man. Those who are the least honorable reach for power wherever and whenever they can. Often they win power for a while, but abusing others always has a cost. We was readers want those who are evil to get their due.Thankfully we know who won that war, but Amanda reminds us that freedom comes at a cost and we get to know those we never met in life, because Amanda brought their examples to life in her storytelling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SILENCE BEFORE SUNSET...
reviews.reviewText: ...as I conclude reading this gripping WWII novel of inspiring, courageous, and brave men and women who fought for a free France and to save Europe.The dialogue, characterization, and vivid descriptions by the author bring to life WWII unlike any "history book".Agonizing emotional turmoil as well as physical pain the characters endured brought the story to life. They became my "best friends", and provided new adventures I shared with them.Thanks for an engaging read, Amanda Lees!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars WWII Resistance Novel
reviews.reviewText: Possible Spoilers!Thank you so much to NetGalley and Amanda Lees for providing me with a complimentary digital audiobook ARC for The Silence Before Dawn coming out September 13, 2022. The honest opinions expressed in this review are my own.Marianne has worked as a resistance worker for months in 1944 Nazi occupied France. She carries out missions from a remote farm in Provence. But one night they are ambushed as German soldiers scatter, capture or kill every person there. Mourning the loss of her friends, Marianne fights to go on and survive. Her secret agent life as been compromised, but she must go on. Her fiancé Jack was seized by the Butcher of Lyon. Marianne must race against time to find him and prove he isn’t the traitor who betrayed them.With her fellow women agents at her side, she sets out on a dangerous mission to save Jack. Can she win the battle to win the war or will her efforts be in vain?Overall, I enjoyed this story. I’ve read quite a few WWII books. It’s one of my favorite subjects to study. I admire all the efforts of the brave men and women who fought during the war. There were so many who were just ordinary civilians but they fought to protect themselves, their families and their country.It kind of felt like the plot to the movie Charlotte Gray. I really love that movie, but this book wasn’t what I was expecting. There was more romance than I thought. I know Marianne was a strong character who accomplished a lot, but sometimes she seemed to come off as a bit arrogant. I think the plot has to do with that as well. Because her whole mission is to save her fiancé, it makes it seem as if her character is reduced to that, instead of all of her work as a spy for the resistance. It’s not a bad thing and I know she was trying to take down the Lyon, but I kind of wish there was a little more to it. I just think there was something missing for me. It didn’t seem like it was much of a group effort and it was mostly about Marianne and Jack.I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys WWII romance resistance stories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very good and intriguing war story.
reviews.reviewText: The author has written a story of intrigue and love as the resistance make convert plans to do what ever is needed to free France from the German occupation. A story full of deception and cruelty against the members of the resistance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a good look at the wonderful women who stood tall in the fight against the Nazi's. It showcased some real history of the brutality of those Nazi's named. It was a story and a really good one with real events mixed in with a love story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of my favorites!
reviews.reviewText: This book kept me interested the entire way through it. Being honest though I hated the ending I have so many questions unanswered. I loved the hint of smutt in the book nice touch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars YThe Silence Before Dawn
reviews.reviewText: A lovely World War II historical novel about the French resistance. It involves members of the SOE who are successfully fighting the occupying Germans

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a book I couldn't put down well written, wonder if there is a sequel as would like to know what happened to the resistance after the war.
Great storyline and well written. The characters are very well depicted as are their emotions. The story is engaging and has kept my heart beating fast.Well done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed the book from start to finish, with a gripping story which made you feel as though you were running with them. Not normally the type of book i would read, but the strong storyline, even stronger female leads and a good pace to it made it something that has to be finished. An exciting start to the series, role in the next book

I have read many WWII books, many about the bravery of SOE members who went into France to fight Nazism. They were exceedingly brave.This author has significantly exaggerated the roles played by the French Resistance. Male and female. There simply weren’t that many that really took on the Nazis, especially in Vichy France. However, the author states that this is a work of fiction and it certainly is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 13, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. The characters are so vivid and the backstories so engaging. I found myself anxious coming to chapter ends as I was full of concern for the characters outcome.I cannot wait to read the next in the series
